page.title: 08QUATFORD CONTINUED
page.content: A resident of Quatford had the following views: "I consider it as a fairly active community, having both a Women's Institute and a Youth Club. It mainly consists of old residents but more young people are moving to the area. I find that many previous residents feel a compassion for the area and return to attend church services and other activities maintaining their links with the village.Many ex_residents own caravans on the nearby sites and so return for short breaks. Transport is a problem especially for school children.They rely solely on their parents for transportation to and from Bridgnorth. Tourists visit the area mainly at weekends,fishing on the River Severn being a major attraction."
